text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Thomas John a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Sydney Australia today I'm going to show
you how to register an application load
balancer behind a network load balancer
let's get
started after logging into the AWS
Management console go to the Amazon
elastic Cloud computer console and
navigate to the load balancing under the
load balancing section
then choose Target groups choose create
Target group choose a Target type choose
application load balancer for Target
group name enter a name for the Target
group choose protocol as TCP and then
for Port choose 84 HTTP traffic remember
to select the port number where the
application load balancer listener is
configured select the virtual private
Cloud VPC for your application load
balancer choose HTTP for the application
load balancer H check that returns a
HTTP 200 to 399 status code and keep the
default path AS
Slash then choose
next in the register application load
balancer section choose register now for
application load balancer select the
required application load balancer that
must handle the request note that you
can specify a single single application
load balancer as the target the
application load balancer that you
specify must have a listener on the same
port as the target group that you are
creating for this demo I have an
application load balancer that has a
listener on Port 80 select the create
Target group button next I will create
and configure a network load balancer to
forward traffic to the application load
balancer Target group that we just
created open the Amazon E2 console in
the navigation paint expand load
balancing and then choose load balancers
choose create a load
balancer for load balancer types choose
Network load balancer and then choose
create enter a name for the network load
balancer in the scheme choose internet
facing because we are testing directly
using a web browser from the internet
for IP address type choose ipv4 select
your VPC
for Network mappings choose one or more
availability zones and subnets let's
choose public subnets because this load
balancer scheme is internet
facing for ipv4 address choose either
assigned by AWS or use an elastic IP
address if there are any to be assigned
here let's choose assigned by
AWS selecting a security group that
allows Port 0
traffic in the listeners and routing
section for protocol choose
TCP and then for Port choose at for
default action select forward to and
choose the target group that contains
the application load balancer as
registered targets created
earlier choose create load
balancer when everything is configured
test the setup by sending traffic to the
network load balancer DNS name or IP
address by following these steps you
have registered an application load
balancer behind a network load balancer
which allows you to use the features and
capabilities of both load balancer types
the network load balancer handles the
initial traffic distribution and static
IP while application load balancer
provides Advanced routing and content
based routing capabilities and now you
know how to register an application load
balancer behind a netork load
balancer thanks for watching and Happy
Cloud Computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
